articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas official Sami Abu Zuhri said on Wednesday that U.S. President Donald Trump's remarks about taking over the Gaza Strip are "ridiculous" and "absurd" and could destabilise the Middle East.
articles.title: Hamas official says Trump's remarks about taking over Gaza could ignite the region

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. Arab American and Muslim leaders, including some who supported Donald Trump in the 2024 election, criticized the president's proposal for the U.S. to take over Gaza and resettle Palestinians, but some of them said they still believed he was the best option for lasting peace in the region.
articles.title: Arab American, Muslim leaders decry Trump comments on Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish police said on Wednesday that "erroneous narratives" were being spread on social media regarding the mass shooting on Tuesday at an adult education centre, the Nordic country's deadliest gun attack.
articles.title: Swedish police say 'erroneous narratives' are spreading online after mass school shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwandan-backed M23 rebels have seized control of the town of Nyabibwe in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo's South Kivu province, eight sources said on Wednesday - an apparent violation of a unilateral ceasefire they declared this week.
articles.title: Rebels in Congo capture town despite ceasefire, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prince Rahim Al-Hussaini was named the 50th hereditary Imam, or spiritual leader of the Shia Ismaili Muslims, on Wednesday following the unsealing of his father Aga Khan IV's will, the Aga Khan Development Network said in a statement.
articles.title: Rahim Al-Hussaini named Ismaili Muslims' new spiritual leader after father's death

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Guatemala will accept 40% more deportation flights including both Guatemalan deportees and those of other nationalities.
articles.title: Guatemala to accept more US deportation flights after Rubio talks

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he wants to resettle Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to Egypt and Jordan, demolish remaining buildings to make way for a Riviera-style development project and place the occupied territory under U.S. "ownership".
articles.title: How Trump's Gaza proposals could violate international law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump's plan for the United States to take over Gaza, permanently displacing Palestinians who live there and creating the "Riviera of the Middle East," has upset Arab nations and Western allies and would overturn decades of American policy in the region.
articles.title: Explainer: What to know about Trump's Gaza Strip proposal

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres told President Donald Trump on Wednesday to avoid ethnic cleansing in Gaza after the U.S. leader proposed that Palestinians resettle elsewhere and the United States take over the war-torn enclave.
articles.title: United Nations chief warns Trump against ethnic cleansing in Gaza

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Wednesday blocked a settlement between families who have sued Alex Jones over his false claims about the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School mass shooting, saying their attempt to divide the bankrupt conspiracy theorist's assets exceeded his court’s authority.
articles.title: Judge blocks Sandy Hook families' settlement in Alex Jones' bankruptcy
